snippet: After a change in Senate filibuster rules, judges appointed by Democrats now hold a majority of seats on the United States Courts of Appeals, a tilt that has far-reaching consequences for President Obama’s legacy.
abstract: Judges appointed by Democratic presidents on federal appeals courts considerably outnumber judges appointed by Republican presidents for first time in more than a decade; shift will have far-reaching consequences for law and Pres Obama's legacy.
lead_paragraph: After a change in Senate filibuster rules, judges appointed by Democrats now hold a majority of seats on the United States Courts of Appeals, a tilt that has far-reaching consequences for President Obama’s legacy.

headline.main: Building Legacy, Obama Reshapes Appellate Bench
headline.print_headline: Eye on Legacy, Obama Shapes Appeals Courts
